title: Homeowners could have to convert garages and conservatories into polling stations to ensure a Christmas election can go ahead
text:
Homeowners in rural areas could be asked to convert their garages and conservatories into temporary polling stations to ensure that a Christmas general election can go ahead.

The Association of Electoral Administrators is worried that a Dec 12 election will be difficult to stage in rural areas where village halls that double as polling stations are already booked out due to Christmas parties and events.

Laura Lock, the association's deputy chief executive, said polling stations could be set up in people's conservatories, garages even caravan awnings to deal with a shortage of venues.

In rural areas each polling station could see between 300 and 400 people arrive to vote.
